arm_group.description: No computed-assisted information program will be administered.
computed-assisted information program will be administered.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is planning to develop the computed-assisted information program and determine
      whether the computed-assisted information program are superior to routine discussion for
      informing parents in the emergency department (ED) about risks, benefits, and alternatives
      to receiving procedural sedation for their children.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Parental Educational Intervention to Facilitate Informed Consent for Pediatric Procedural Sedation in the Emergency Department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Parents with patients under 18 years of age

          -  patients receive the procedural sedation and anesthesia in the emergency department

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  clinically unstable

          -  refuse to participate

          -  unable to understand the consent process for this study

clinical_study.official_title: A Parental Educational Intervention to Facilitate Informed Consent for Pediatric Procedural Sedation in the Emergency Department

primary_outcome.description: a structured questionnaire with knowledge measure and satisfaction will be delivered to the participants for data collection.
primary_outcome.time_frame: before and immediately after the intervention when participants are in the emergency department, it is expected to take an expected average time of one hour

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
